questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents with progressive night blindness and peripheral vision loss since adolescence. Fundoscopic examination findings is shown in the image. Which of the following electrophysiologic findings is most consistent with the pathology shown?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal photopic and scotopic responses on electroretinography (ERG)

options.label: B
options.text: Absent cone responses, preserved rod responses

options.label: C
options.text: Extinguished or severely reduced scotopic and photopic ERG responses

options.label: D
options.text: Increased b-wave amplitude with preserved a-wave on ERG

questions.correct_answer: C. Extinguished or severely reduced scotopic and photopic ERG responses
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Extinguished or severely reduced scotopic and photopic ERG responses

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Retinitis Pigmentosa is characterized by progressive loss of rods and cones, leading to extinguished ERG responses in advanced stages. Classic signs include bone spicule pigmentation, vessel attenuation, and optic disc pallor.
  • ➤ Retinitis Pigmentosa is characterized by progressive loss of rods and cones, leading to extinguished ERG responses in advanced stages.
  • ➤ Retinitis Pigmentosa
  • ➤ Classic signs include bone spicule pigmentation, vessel attenuation, and optic disc pallor.

questions.text: A 47-year-old woman presents with a palpable breast lump. Histopathological examination of the biopsy reveals tumor cells with signet ring morphology, mucin deposition, and a pattern of infiltration within fibrous stroma, as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Invasive lobular carcinoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Invasive lobular carcinoma of the breast typically shows signet ring cells, mucin production, and the Indian file pattern on histology due to loss of E-cadherin, distinguishing it from other breast cancer subtypes.

questions.text: A baby presented with abdominal pain. On examination, a mass is palpated in the right lumbar region. A barium enema is done, and the image is given below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Intussusception

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Intussusception should be suspected in infants with episodic pain, vomiting, and red currant jelly stools, and is confirmed by the claw sign on contrast enema, which can also be therapeutic.
  • ➤ Intussusception should be suspected in infants with episodic pain, vomiting, and red currant jelly stools, and is confirmed by the claw sign on contrast enema, which can also be therapeutic.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is most accurate about epidemic dropsy?

options.label: A
options.text: Mortality is uniformly low and limited to children.

options.label: B
options.text: Disease affects only elderly or immunocompromised.

options.label: C
options.text: Mortality can range from 5% to 50%, and all age groups except breastfed infants may be affected.

options.label: D
options.text: It presents with inflammatory cellulitis and is due to fungal contamination.

questions.correct_answer: C. Mortality can range from 5% to 50%, and all age groups except breastfed infants may be affected.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Mortality can range from 5% to 50%, and all age groups except breastfed infants may be affected.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epidemic dropsy is a toxicological public health emergency primarily caused by sanguinarine in adulterated mustard oil. It presents with non-inflammatory edema , affects all age groups except breastfed infants , and can have high mortality if not recognized and managed early.
  • ➤ Epidemic dropsy is a toxicological public health emergency primarily caused by sanguinarine in adulterated mustard oil.
  • ➤ toxicological public health emergency
  • ➤ sanguinarine
  • ➤ It presents with non-inflammatory edema , affects all age groups except breastfed infants , and can have high mortality if not recognized and managed early.
  • ➤ non-inflammatory edema
  • ➤ all age groups except breastfed infants
  • ➤ high mortality

questions.text: A 32-year-old pregnant woman, gravida 2 para 1, presents to the obstetric clinic at 8 weeks gestation with complaints of persistent nausea and vomiting for the last 10 days. She has already tried dietary changes but symptoms have not improved. She is hemodynamically stable and her labs rule out other causes. She is diagnosed with hyperemesis gravidarum and requires pharmacological therapy. Which of the following medications is safest and most appropriate for controlling her symptoms at this stage of pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Doxylamine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Doxylamine , often with pyridoxine , is the first line and safest medication for nausea and vomiting in pregnancy , especially in hyperemesis gravidarum .
  • ➤ Doxylamine
  • ➤ pyridoxine
  • ➤ first line
  • ➤ nausea and vomiting in pregnancy
  • ➤ hyperemesis gravidarum

questions.text: A public health team is investigating a case of zoonotic infection linked to unpasteurized milk consumption. They note that the pathogen involved is able to withstand 30 minutes of pasteurization at 63°C (Holder method). Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Coxiella burnetii

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Coxiella burnetii is a highly heat-resistant bacterium that can survive 30 minutes of standard batch pasteurization and is the causative agent of Q fever, often transmitted through unpasteurized dairy products or inhalation from animal waste.

questions.text: A 32-year-old man volunteers for a research study on the effects of fasting. After consuming only water for 48 hours, he is brought in for testing. He reports feeling slightly fatigued but is otherwise alert and responsive. Blood glucose is mildly decreased, ketone levels are elevated, and insulin levels are significantly suppressed. Attending endocrinologist explains that the body has shifted from using glucose to using fatty acids and ketone bodies for energy. Which of the following hormones is primarily responsible for stimulating hepatic gluconeogenesis and glycogenolysis to maintain plasma glucose levels?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Glucagon

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Glucagon is the dominant hormone during fasting. It ensures blood glucose remains available for obligate glucose users like the brain and RBCs . As fasting continues, the liver uses amino acids and glycerol for gluconeogenesis and produces ketone bodies from excess acetyl-CoA.
  • ➤ Glucagon is the dominant hormone during fasting.
  • ➤ Glucagon
  • ➤ dominant hormone
  • ➤ It ensures blood glucose remains available for obligate glucose users like the brain and RBCs .
  • ➤ obligate glucose users
  • ➤ brain and RBCs
  • ➤ As fasting continues, the liver uses amino acids and glycerol for gluconeogenesis and produces ketone bodies from excess acetyl-CoA.
  • ➤ gluconeogenesis
  • ➤ ketone bodies

questions.text: In which of the following scenarios would the Hardy-Weinberg law not be valid? A population undergoing high rates of non-random mating due to caste-based endogamy A large, randomly mating population with no selection or mutation A small, isolated tribal population with frequent inbreeding A population with high immigration of individuals from genetically diverse regions A dynamic population where certain genotypes have a survival advantage
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1, 3, 4 and 5 only

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium provides a mathematical model to estimate allele and genotype frequencies. However, it becomes invalid if any of the following factors— mutation, selection, gene flow, non-random mating, or genetic drift —are present in the population.
  • ➤ Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium provides a mathematical model to estimate allele and genotype frequencies.
  • ➤ Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium
  • ➤ However, it becomes invalid if any of the following factors— mutation, selection, gene flow, non-random mating, or genetic drift —are present in the population.
  • ➤ mutation, selection, gene flow, non-random mating, or genetic drift

questions.text: A 32-year-old male presents with progressive cervical lymphadenopathy. He is found to be HIV-positive with a CD4 count of 42/mm³. Fungal culture of lymph node aspirate shows a characteristic colony as shown in the image. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Talaromyces marneffei

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Talaromyces marneffei causes disseminated fungal infection in immunocompromised patients and forms a velvety mold with red diffusible pigment in culture—a key diagnostic clue.
  • ➤ Talaromyces marneffei
  • ➤ velvety mold with red diffusible pigment

questions.text: A 66-year-old man presents 5 days after inferior wall MI with sudden dyspnea, hypotension, and a new systolic murmur at apex. CXR shows pulmonary edema. Echo reveals flail posterior mitral leaflet with severe MR. What is the most appropriate management?

options.label: B
options.text: Balloon intra-aortic counterpulsation and urgent surgery

options.label: D
options.text: Mitral valve repair electively after 2 weeks

questions.correct_answer: B. Balloon intra-aortic counterpulsation and urgent surgery
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Balloon intra-aortic counterpulsation and urgent surgery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 3-year-old child is brought to the emergency room with confusion, vomiting, and shallow breathing after accidentally ingesting a chemical used to preserve plant seeds. Laboratory evaluation shows elevated lactate levels and metabolic acidosis. On further investigation, it is found that the chemical inhibits the flow of electrons at the cytochrome c oxidase step of the electron transport chain. Which of the following agents is the most likely cause of the child’s symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cyanide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cyanide poisoning inhibits cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV) of the mitochondrial electron transport chain, leading to blocked oxidative phosphorylation , lactic acidosis , and cellular hypoxia despite adequate oxygen availability.
  • ➤ Cyanide poisoning
  • ➤ cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV)
  • ➤ blocked oxidative phosphorylation
  • ➤ lactic acidosis
  • ➤ cellular hypoxia

questions.text: Which of the following cytokines is not involved in the Th1 (T-helper 1) immune response?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) IL-4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ IL-4 is a Th2 cytokine and is not involved in Th1-mediated responses , which are instead characterized by cytokines like IFN-γ , IL-2 , and IL-12 .
  • ➤ IL-4 is a Th2 cytokine
  • ➤ not involved in Th1-mediated responses
  • ➤ IFN-γ
  • ➤ IL-2
  • ➤ IL-12

questions.text: Which of the following is an inhibitor of the intestinal mucosal transporter NPC1L1, responsible for the absorption of dietary and biliary cholesterol?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ezetimibe

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ezetimibe lowers LDL cholesterol by inhibiting the NPC1L1 transporter in the intestinal mucosa, thereby reducing absorption of dietary and biliary cholesterol.
  • ➤ Ezetimibe
  • ➤ inhibiting the NPC1L1 transporter

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman presents to the fertility clinic with concerns about difficulty conceiving. Her history reveals irregular cycles, and after an evaluation, a significant decline in ovarian reserve is confirmed through hormone testing and ultrasound. What is the most appropriate treatment option for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: In vitro fertilization (IVF) and intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI)

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Donor egg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In women with significantly diminished ovarian reserve , donor egg IVF offers the best chance for successful pregnancy, bypassing the issue of poor egg quality and increasing the likelihood of a successful outcome.

  • ➤ donor egg IVF
  • ➤ best chance

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy is/are incorrect? It is most commonly inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern involving MYH7 or MYBPC3 gene mutations. Histological examination reveals myocyte disarray and patchy interstitial fibrosis. The murmur intensity increases when the patient is in a squatting position. The condition often leads to exertional syncope or sudden cardiac death in young athletes. Asymmetric septal hypertrophy is the key structural abnormality that contributes to dynamic left ventricular outflow tract obstruction.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Only statement 3 is incorrect

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM) , murmur intensity increases with maneuvers that decrease preload (e.g., Valsalva, standing) and decreases with maneuvers that increase preload (e.g., squatting). Recognizing autosomal dominant inheritance , myocyte disarray , and sudden death risk in young athletes is essential for diagnosis and management.
  • ➤ In Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM) , murmur intensity increases with maneuvers that decrease preload (e.g., Valsalva, standing) and decreases with maneuvers that increase preload (e.g., squatting).
  • ➤ Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy (HCM)
  • ➤ increases with maneuvers that decrease preload
  • ➤ decreases with maneuvers that increase preload
  • ➤ Recognizing autosomal dominant inheritance , myocyte disarray , and sudden death risk in young athletes is essential for diagnosis and management.
  • ➤ autosomal dominant inheritance
  • ➤ myocyte disarray
  • ➤ sudden death risk in young athletes

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman presents with dysuria and increased urinary frequency. A urine culture is ordered to identify the causative pathogen. The microbiology lab uses CLED (Cystine Lactose Electrolyte Deficient) agar instead of MacConkey agar. What is the primary reason for choosing this medium for urinary cultures?

options.label: A
options.text: Enhances recovery of Gram-positive cocci in urine

options.label: B
options.text: Facilitates detection of non-lactose fermenters in stool samples

options.label: C
options.text: Suppresses the swarming growth of Proteus species

options.label: D
options.text: Specifically isolates enteric organisms causing urinary tract infections

questions.correct_answer: C. Suppresses the swarming growth of Proteus species
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Suppresses the swarming growth of Proteus species

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CLED agar is preferred for urine cultures because it prevents the swarming of Proteus species, allowing accurate isolation and identification of urinary pathogens.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the SMAD4 gene is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: SMAD4 is a tumor suppressor gene implicated in the TGF-β signaling pathway.

options.label: B
options.text: SMAD4 mutations are associated with juvenile polyposis syndrome and pancreatic carcinoma.

options.label: C
options.text: SMAD4 promotes angiogenesis and enhances tumor invasiveness.

options.label: D
options.text: SMAD4 exerts its effects primarily by inhibiting mitogenic signaling pathways.

questions.correct_answer: C. SMAD4 promotes angiogenesis and enhances tumor invasiveness.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) SMAD4 promotes angiogenesis and enhances tumor invasiveness.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ SMAD4 is a tumor suppressor gene involved in the TGF-β pathway. It inhibits mitogenic signaling and is mutated in various cancers like juvenile polyposis syndrome, pancreatic, and colorectal carcinoma. It does not promote angiogenesis or tumor invasion.
  • ➤ SMAD4 is a tumor suppressor gene involved in the TGF-β pathway.
  • ➤ SMAD4 is a tumor suppressor gene involved in the TGF-β pathway.
  • ➤ It inhibits mitogenic signaling and is mutated in various cancers like juvenile polyposis syndrome, pancreatic, and colorectal carcinoma.
  • ➤ It does not promote angiogenesis or tumor invasion.
  • ➤ not

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman (P4L4) presents with post-coital bleeding. On examination, a 2 cm growth is observed on the cervix, which bleeds on touch. The vagina appears normal, and the parametrium is free. A biopsy confirms squamous cell carcinoma of the cervix. What is the most appropriate management option for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Radical type 3 hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy

options.label: B
options.text: Radical type 2 hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Radical type 3 hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Radical type 3 hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For early-stage cervical cancer , radical type 3 hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy is the gold standard treatment . It involves the removal of the uterus, cervix, upper vagina, and parametrial tissue and is appropriate for tumors like this 2 cm cervical growth that is confined to the cervix.
  • ➤ For early-stage cervical cancer , radical type 3 hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy is the gold standard treatment .
  • ➤ early-stage cervical cancer
  • ➤ radical type 3 hysterectomy
  • ➤ gold standard treatment
  • ➤ It involves the removal of the uterus, cervix, upper vagina, and parametrial tissue and is appropriate for tumors like this 2 cm cervical growth that is confined to the cervix.

questions.text: A 56-year-old man with newly diagnosed diffuse large B-cell lymphoma has bulky abdominal nodes and LDH >2× ULN. His creatinine is 1.8 mg/dL. Chemotherapy is to start tomorrow. What is the most appropriate prophylactic step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Rasburicase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with regards to Helicobacter pylori eradication in peptic ulcer disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Proton-pump inhibitor is taken with two antibiotics.

options.label: B
options.text: Treatment is prescribed for at least 7 days.

options.label: C
options.text: Treatment of Helicobacter pylori infection leads to vitamin B12 deficiency.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients requiring long-term NSAIDs should undergo Helicobacter pylori eradication therapy to reduce ulcer risk.

questions.correct_answer: C. Treatment of Helicobacter pylori infection leads to vitamin B12 deficiency.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Treatment of Helicobacter pylori infection leads to vitamin B12 deficiency.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Helicobacter pylori eradication is achieved with a PPI and two antibiotics for at least 7 days (preferably 14). Treatment does not lead to vitamin B12 deficiency; instead, chronic infection may impair B12 absorption due to atrophic gastritis.
  • ➤ Helicobacter pylori eradication is achieved with a PPI and two antibiotics for at least 7 days (preferably 14).
  • ➤ Treatment does not lead to vitamin B12 deficiency; instead, chronic infection may impair B12 absorption due to atrophic gastritis.

questions.text: A 40-year-old patient is undergoing Functional Endoscopic Sinus Surgery (FESS) for chronic rhinosinusitis unresponsive to medical therapy. During the procedure, the surgeon uses the instrument shown in the image below. Which of the following instruments is most appropriately used for uncinectomy during FESS?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Blakesley forceps

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blakesley forceps are a fundamental instrument in FESS used for removing the uncinate process, polyps, or other soft tissue structures under endoscopic guidance. Their angulated design enables precise maneuvering within the nasal cavity, essential for effective sinus surgery.
  • ➤ Blakesley forceps are a fundamental instrument in FESS used for removing the uncinate process, polyps, or other soft tissue structures under endoscopic guidance.

questions.text: A 58-year-old male smoker is undergoing evaluation for persistent abdominal discomfort. Ultrasound reveals a 5.6 cm infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA). He has normal renal function and no major comorbidities. CT angiography confirms the findings. What is the next step?

options.label: B
options.text: Open surgical repair via transabdominal approach

questions.correct_answer: B. Open surgical repair via transabdominal approach
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Open surgical repair via transabdominal approach

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For asymptomatic infrarenal AAA >5.5 cm with favorable anatomy, EVAR is the preferred intervention due to lower perioperative risk.

questions.text: A 14-year-old girl presents with progressively worsening dysmenorrhea, which began after her menarche 9 months ago. Despite using oral analgesics and NSAIDs, she is unable to control her severe pain. Based on this presentation, which of the following congenital anomalies is most likely present?

options.label: C
options.text: Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome

questions.correct_answer: C. Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome presents with cyclic dysmenorrhea and painful menstrual accumulation due to obstructed vaginal flow. This condition is associated with renal anomalies , and it is important to consider in adolescent girls with severe menstrual pain despite the use of analgesics.
  • ➤ Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome presents with cyclic dysmenorrhea and painful menstrual accumulation due to obstructed vaginal flow.
  • ➤ Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome
  • ➤ cyclic dysmenorrhea
  • ➤ painful menstrual accumulation
  • ➤ This condition is associated with renal anomalies , and it is important to consider in adolescent girls with severe menstrual pain despite the use of analgesics.
  • ➤ renal anomalies

questions.text: Which of the following is not a function or clinical feature associated with the glossopharyngeal nerve?

options.label: A
options.text: Innervates the stylopharyngeus muscle to assist in swallowing

options.label: B
options.text: Provides taste sensation to the anterior two-thirds of the tongue

options.label: C
options.text: Carries somatic sensory fibers from the pharynx and middle ear

options.label: D
options.text: May be damaged in head and neck surgery, leading to glossopharyngeal neuralgia

questions.correct_answer: B. Provides taste sensation to the anterior two-thirds of the tongue
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Provides taste sensation to the anterior two-thirds of the tongue

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX) is a mixed cranial nerve originating from the medulla. It provides motor, sensory, and special sensory innervation to structures in the oropharynx and posterior tongue. Injury results in dysphagia, reduced gag reflex, and loss of posterior taste sensation.
  • ➤ The glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX) is a mixed cranial nerve originating from the medulla.
  • ➤ It provides motor, sensory, and special sensory innervation to structures in the oropharynx and posterior tongue.
  • ➤ Injury results in dysphagia, reduced gag reflex, and loss of posterior taste sensation.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male athlete is undergoing training at high altitude (4,000 meters) for a competitive event. After a week, he has polycythemia and an elevated hematocrit. However, his GFR is noted to be lower than baseline despite no signs of dehydration or hypotension. Which of the following is the most likely physiological mechanism responsible for the decreased GFR?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased blood viscosity, and reduced renal blood flow

options.label: B
options.text: Increased plasma oncotic pressure reducing filtration fraction

options.label: C
options.text: Constriction of the efferent arteriole via angiotensin II

options.label: D
options.text: Increased renal sympathetic stimulation causing vasodilation of the afferent arteriole

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased blood viscosity, and reduced renal blood flow
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Increased blood viscosity, and reduced renal blood flow

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Increased distal Na⁺ delivery triggers tubuloglomerular feedback, leading to afferent arteriole constriction and a reduction in GFR to protect nephron integrity during states like high-altitude adaptation.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding acquired hemophilia are incorrect? Acquired hemophilia involves the formation of autoantibodies that inactivate factor VIII. Activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) is typically shortened due to increased bleeding tendency. A mixing study typically shows correction of the prolonged aPTT in this condition. The Bethesda assay is used to quantify inhibitors against factor VIII. The intrinsic coagulation pathway is impaired, leading to isolated aPTT prolongation.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 2 and 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In acquired hemophilia, autoantibodies against factor VIII lead to prolonged aPTT, failure to correct with mixing studies, and diagnosis is confirmed by the Bethesda assay.

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with longstanding uncontrolled hypertension presents with exertional dyspnea. Echocardiogram shows concentric left ventricular hypertrophy. Which of the following changes would most likely be observed in his left ventricular pressure-volume loop?

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased end-systolic pressure and increased stroke volume

options.label: B
options.text: Shift of the loop upward and to the right with increased end-diastolic volume

options.label: C
options.text: Increased end-systolic pressure with decreased end-diastolic volume

options.label: D
options.text: Downward shift of the loop with increased compliance

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased end-systolic pressure with decreased end-diastolic volume
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Increased end-systolic pressure with decreased end-diastolic volume

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In chronic hypertension with concentric LV hypertrophy, pressure-volume loops show increased end-systolic pressure and decreased compliance, leading to smaller end-diastolic volumes and reduced stroke volume.

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presents with a pulsatile mass in the supraclavicular region of the neck. On physical examination, the mass is compressible and exhibits an expansile pulsation.   • ➤ In a patient with a pulsatile neck mass, the first investigation must rule out vascular origin. Doppler ultrasonography is the initial modality of choice because it is non-invasive, safe, and effective for evaluating vascular lesions before considering advanced imaging or intervention.

questions.text: An 18-year-old female presents with sudden-onset severe headache, photophobia, fever of 101°F, and altered sensorium. On examination, she has nuchal rigidity and papilledema. A lumbar puncture is performed, and Gram stain of the CSF is shown below. Based on the findings, which of the following is the most likely causative organism?
questions.explanation:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neisseria meningitidis presents as Gram-negative diplococci in CSF Gram stain and is a leading cause of bacterial meningitis in adolescents and young adults . Prompt diagnosis is critical due to rapid progression and potential for septicemia.

questions.text: A 28-year-old Rh-negative pregnant woman presents with a history of prior miscarriage. She is currently 28 weeks pregnant and is being monitored for Rh sensitization. Which of the following investigations is the most appropriate for monitoring the fetus in this situation?
questions.correct_answer: D. MCA Doppler peak systolic velocity
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) MCA Doppler peak systolic velocity

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

  • ➤ MCA Doppler peak systolic velocity

questions.text: A 40-year-old individual presents with slowly progressive skin lesions on the face and ears that have been present for several months. The patient denies any systemic symptoms. On physical examination, there are well-demarcated, scaly plaques on the ears and surrounding areas, with evidence of central depigmentation and perifollicular plugging. A classic Shuster's sign is also observed on clinical examination. Biopsy reveals hyperkeratosis, follicular plugging, and chronic inflammation involving the dermo-epidermal junction. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Discoid Lupus Erythematosus (DLE)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Discoid Lupus Erythematosus (DLE) is a chronic autoimmune dermatosis characterized by sharply demarcated, scaly plaques with scarring and depigmentation, commonly affecting the face and ears. Shuster’s sign (ear involvement) is a diagnostic clinical finding unique to this condition.
  • ➤ Discoid Lupus Erythematosus (DLE) is a chronic autoimmune dermatosis characterized by sharply demarcated, scaly plaques with scarring and depigmentation, commonly affecting the face and ears.
  • ➤ Shuster’s sign (ear involvement) is a diagnostic clinical finding unique to this condition.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the role of growth hormone (GH) and somatomedins is/are correct? Growth hormone exerts most of its growth-promoting actions indirectly via somatomedins. Somatomedin C, also known as IGF-1, is the most biologically important somatomedin. The half-life of IGF-1 is short compared to GH, similar to that of unbound peptide hormones. Blood levels of IGF-1 do not correlate with GH levels due to their independent regulation.
questions.correct_answer: A. Only statements 1 and 2 are correct
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Only statements 1 and 2 are correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Growth hormone stimulates the liver to produce somatomedins, mainly IGF-1 (Somatomedin C), which mediate the growth-promoting effects of GH; IGF-1 binds to carrier proteins and has a long half-life, with its blood levels reflecting GH activity.

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman presents for evaluation after 18 months of unsuccessful attempts to conceive. Her cycles are regular, and serum hormone levels are within normal range. On further assessment, she reports chronic pelvic pain and severe dysmenorrhea. A recent laparoscopic evaluation confirmed the presence of pelvic endometriotic lesions. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her infertility?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Tubal obstruction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most likely etiology of infertility in women with endometriosis is tubal obstruction due to adhesions or anatomical distortion from ectopic endometrial implants.

questions.text: A 9-year-old child is brought to the clinic due to a history of recurrent infections, easy bruising, and persistent lymphadenopathy. The child's parents report that the lymph nodes have been enlarged for several months and are not painful. Laboratory tests reveal anemia, thrombocytopenia, and elevated levels of double-negative T cells (CD3+, CD4-, CD8-) in the peripheral blood. The child has a history of autoimmune hemolytic anemia. A gene mutation analysis confirms a defect in the Fas receptor gene. Which of the following conditions is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Autoimmune Lymphoproliferative Syndrome (ALPS)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Autoimmune Lymphoproliferative Syndrome (ALPS) is characterized by chronic lymphadenopathy, autoimmune cytopenias, and elevated levels of double-negative T cells. A mutation in the Fas receptor gene, which is involved in regulating apoptosis, is a hallmark of this disorder. The combination of these clinical and laboratory features are essential for diagnosing ALPS and helps in distinguishing it from other immunodeficiency disorders.
  • ➤ Autoimmune Lymphoproliferative Syndrome (ALPS) is characterized by chronic lymphadenopathy, autoimmune cytopenias, and elevated levels of double-negative T cells.
  • ➤ Autoimmune Lymphoproliferative Syndrome (ALPS)
  • ➤ A mutation in the Fas receptor gene, which is involved in regulating apoptosis, is a hallmark of this disorder.
  • ➤ The combination of these clinical and laboratory features are essential for diagnosing ALPS and helps in distinguishing it from other immunodeficiency disorders.

questions.text: A 28-year-old primigravida in labor presents with repeated urges to pass urine and premature bearing down. On examination, there is infra-umbilical flattening, and the fetal heart is heard on the lateral side. What is the most likely presentation and position of the fetus?

The classic features include infra-umbilical flattening , lateral fetal heart tones , and the urge to pass urine due to pressure on the bladder. This is an important consideration for obstetric management during labor.

  • ➤ the urge to pass urine

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with COPD and atrial fibrillation presents with acute dyspnea. He was admitted for an upper GI bleed a week ago and got discharged. questions.text: Which of the following is more characteristic of Crohn’s disease compared to ulcerative colitis?

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following statements about "compos mentis" and mental illness is correct in the context of decision-making capacity?

options.label: A
options.text: A person with borderline personality disorder who exhibits emotional dysregulation but can still reason through a decision is not compos mentis

options.label: B
options.text: A person with OCD who compulsively checks locks but understands the broader implications of their actions is compos mentis

options.label: C
options.text: A person diagnosed with dissociative identity disorder can never be considered compos mentis because they have multiple, distinct identities

questions.correct_answer: B. A person with OCD who compulsively checks locks but understands the broader implications of their actions is compos mentis
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A person with OCD who compulsively checks locks but understands the broader implications of their actions is compos mentis.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A diagnosis of mental illness does not automatically imply incompetency. Compos mentis refers to the capacity to understand, reason, appreciate, and communicate decisions—regardless of psychiatric diagnosis.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines requires frequent modification due to ongoing changes in the target organism's surface antigens?

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents with dry eyes, arthritis, and recurrent miscarriages. Lab: positive lupus anticoagulant and anticardiolipin antibody. What is the most appropriate treatment to prevent further pregnancy loss?

questions.text: A 42-year-old male presents with persistent nasal congestion and thick post-nasal discharge. questions.text: A 70-year-old man with Parkinson's disease experiences "wearing-off" phenomena despite optimized levodopa/carbidopa therapy. Selegiline is added to his regimen. Which of the following best describes the rationale for this addition?

options.label: C
options.text: Selegiline prolongs dopamine action by inhibiting its breakdown

options.label: D
options.text: It enhances dopamine synthesis in the substantia nigra

questions.correct_answer: C. Selegiline prolongs dopamine action by inhibiting its breakdown
questions.explanation:

Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 47-year-old male patient underwent emergency laparoscopic cholecystectomy for acute cholecystitis. questions.text: A 32-year-old woman undergoes a normal vaginal delivery but develops excessive uterine bleeding that does not respond adequately to uterotonics. questions.text: A 25-year-old male boxer presents with wrist pain after falling onto an outstretched hand during training. Examination reveals tenderness in the anatomical snuffbox. questions.text: A 29-year-old woman with SLE (class IV lupus nephritis) previously treated with mycophenolate now presents with hematuria, proteinuria (3.8 g/day), and S.Cr of 4.1 mg/dl (previous was 1.4). Anti-dsDNA is high and complement levels are low. What is the most appropriate next step?

questions.text: A 63-year-old male, who received a kidney transplant 2 years ago and has been on chronic immunosuppressive therapy, presents with multiple hyperkeratotic lesions on sun-exposed areas of the skin. questions.text: Which of the following toxic plant exposures can be confused with Datura based on seed appearance but does not cause anticholinergic symptoms?

questions.text: A 45-year-old female presents with a firm, enlarging midline neck mass over the past few months. The swelling moves up on deglutition. Her serum calcitonin levels are elevated. What is the likely diagnosis?

questions.text: A neonate is diagnosed with congenital aganglionic megacolon, caused by absence of ganglion cells in the enteric nervous system. These ganglion cells normally arise from which of the following embryological structures?

Disruption in this migration can lead to congenital disorders like Hirschsprung disease, highlighting the clinical relevance of embryonic neural crest derivatives.
  • ➤ The enteric nervous system is derived from neural crest cells.

questions.text: 34-year-old man with pleural TB, confirmed by pleural fluid analysis, was started on anti-tuberculous therapy (ATT) 4 weeks ago. He now presents with fever, increased pleural effusion, and new chest pain. Imaging shows worsening pleural thickening and a new pleural nodule. Pleural fluid cultures remain sterile. questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Paradoxical reaction to ATT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Paradoxical reactions in TB can mimic treatment failure, often occurring 2–12 weeks after starting ATT. Sterile cultures and timing help differentiate from drug resistance or superinfection. Management typically involves continuing ATT and adding anti-inflammatory therapy (e.g., steroids) if severe.
  • ➤ Paradoxical reactions in TB can mimic treatment failure, often occurring 2–12 weeks after starting ATT.
  • ➤ Sterile cultures and timing help differentiate from drug resistance or superinfection.

questions.text: Concerning the clinical use of corticosteroids, which statements are correct? Inhaled corticosteroids are considered safe during pregnancy. Ciclesonide has minimum chances of causing oropharyngeal candidiasis due to its lung-specific activation. Beclomethasone alone can be used as first-line drug in acute asthma attacks. Depot steroids like triamcinolone can lead to proximal muscle weakness.

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ciclesonide is a prodrug inhaled corticosteroid activated in the lungs, minimizing systemic toxicity, especially beneficial in elderly and hepatic-impaired patients. Inhaled corticosteroids are generally safe during pregnancy. Depot steroids like triamcinolone can cause proximal muscle weakness. Inhaled corticosteroids are not used alone for acute asthma attacks.
  • ➤ Ciclesonide is a prodrug inhaled corticosteroid activated in the lungs, minimizing systemic toxicity, especially beneficial in elderly and hepatic-impaired patients.
  • ➤ Inhaled corticosteroids are generally safe during pregnancy.
  • ➤ Depot steroids like triamcinolone can cause proximal muscle weakness. Inhaled corticosteroids are not used alone for acute asthma attacks.

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant G3P2L2 woman presents at 36 weeks of gestation. Ultrasound reveals that the fetus is in an oblique lie. questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the oxygen-hemoglobin dissociation curve are correct? questions.text: A 27-year-old woman presents with a mild headache and notes that her pupils appear unequal. She has also noticed a slight drooping of her left upper eyelid. questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the Rinne tuning fork test are correct? A positive Rinne test indicates air conduction is greater than bone conduction (AC > BC) A positive Rinne test can be seen in both normal hearing and sensorineural hearing loss A negative Rinne test suggests the presence of sensorineural hearing loss In conductive hearing loss, bone conduction is perceived longer than air conduction In bilateral sensorineural loss, Rinne's test may still appear positive in both ears
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1, 2, 4, 5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Rinne tuning fork test helps differentiate between conductive and sensorineural hearing loss by comparing air conduction (AC) and bone conduction (BC) . A positive Rinne test (AC > BC) is seen in normal hearing and sensorineural hearing loss , while a negative Rinne test (BC > AC) indicates conductive hearing loss . Importantly, in bilateral sensorineural loss , the Rinne test may still appear positive in both ears, making interpretation dependent on clinical context.

  • ➤ bone conduction (BC)

  • ➤ positive Rinne test (AC > BC)
  • ➤ normal hearing
  • ➤ sensorineural hearing loss
  • ➤ negative Rinne test (BC > AC)
  • ➤ conductive hearing loss
  • ➤ Importantly, in bilateral sensorineural loss , the Rinne test may still appear positive in both ears, making interpretation dependent on clinical context.
  • ➤ bilateral sensorineural loss

questions.text: Which of the following accurately describes gene functions and vaccine targets related to human papillomavirus (HPV)? questions.text: A 27-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department with acute severe lower abdominal pain. She has a history of 2 months of missed periods. questions.text: A 58-year-old man presents with flank pain and gross hematuria. A CT scan reveals a solid mass in the upper pole of the left kidney. Biopsy of the lesion is shown below. Which of the following findings is most likely to be detected?

questions.text: A 28-year-old male from a rural endemic region presents with multiple hypopigmented patches on his back and arms, some of which are anesthetic. He also complains of bilateral hand numbness and foot drop. On examination, he has thickened ulnar and common peroneal nerves and lagophthalmos. Slit-skin smear is positive for acid-fast bacilli with a bacteriological index (BI) of 4+. A diagnosis of multibacillary Hansen's disease is made. Which of the following statements are true regarding his condition? Type I lepra reaction is a type IV hypersensitivity reaction and is commonly seen in borderline forms of leprosy. Type II lepra reaction can occur even after completion of multidrug therapy and is mediated by immune complex deposition. A bacteriological index (BI) of 4+ indicates paucibacillary disease and is consistent with tuberculoid leprosy. Clofazimine, used in MDT, can cause reddish-black skin discoloration and is effective against lepra reaction. The involvement of the ulnar nerve in this patient is more likely to cause wrist drop than claw hand.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1, 2, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leprosy presents with a spectrum of manifestations depending on host immunity. Reactions (Type I and II) are immunologically distinct. MDT includes rifampicin, dapsone, and clofazimine. Nerve involvement must be correctly linked with clinical deficits to guide prognosis and rehabilitation.
  • ➤ Leprosy presents with a spectrum of manifestations depending on host immunity. Reactions (Type I and II) are immunologically distinct.

questions.text: A 34-year-old male participates in a study assessing postoperative pain scores (range: 0–20) after minor orthopedic procedures. The pain scores of 7 consecutive patients in the study are: 2, 3, 5, 5, 6, 8, 10. During data verification, it is found that the last recorded value (10) was an underestimation. The correct value should be 20. Which of the following statements best describe how this correction will affect the dataset’s statistical characteristics? Select all that apply: The mean will increase The median will remain unchanged The mode will remain unchanged The distribution will shift from symmetric to right skewed
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1, 2, 3 and 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Outliers significantly affect the mean , which is sensitive to extreme values, but generally do not affect the median or mode unless central values are modified. A single high-end outlier in an otherwise symmetric dataset causes positive (right) skewness .

questions.text: A tertiary care hospital implements a new waste disposal protocol that mandates incineration of all contaminated items. However, this includes items such as broken mercury thermometers and PVC-based IV infusion sets. The hospital infection control team raises concerns about toxic emissions and environmental safety. Which of the following is the most appropriate corrective action to ensure safety and compliance with biomedical waste management norms?

options.label: C
options.text: Segregate high mercury and halogenated plastics before incineration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Not all contaminated waste is incinerable. Mercury-containing devices and halogenated plastics (like PVC) must be segregated and excluded from incineration. Proper segregation is the cornerstone of biomedical waste management and ensures compliance with safety and environmental standards.
  • ➤ Not all contaminated waste is incinerable. Mercury-containing devices and halogenated plastics (like PVC) must be segregated and excluded from incineration.
  • ➤ Mercury-containing devices and halogenated plastics (like PVC)
  • ➤ segregated and excluded

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy is brought to the pediatrician for evaluation of white patches on his skin and hair. questions.text: A 2-year-old child presents with developmental regression, irritability, and a rigid posturing in the limbs. questions.text: A forensic expert examines a body where rigor mortis is well-developed in the facial muscles, neck, and upper limbs, but not yet present in the lower limbs. Which of the following most accurately estimates the postmortem interval (PMI)?

options.text: Non-specific activation of immune cells via cytokine storm

questions.correct_answer: B. Autoimmune targeting due to molecular mimicry with streptococcal antigens
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Autoimmune targeting due to molecular mimicry with streptococcal antigens

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acute rheumatic fever is caused by autoimmune cross-reactivity between streptococcal antigens (especially M protein) and host tissues (molecular mimicry), leading to inflammation in the heart, joints, skin, and CNS.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man with cirrhosis presents with fever and altered sensorium. Ascitic fluid: total neutrophils 340/mm³, SAAG = 1.5, albumin 1.0 g/dL. His S. bilirubin is 5 mg/dL and S. Cr is 1.4 mg/dL. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Start IV cefotaxime and IV albumin

options.label: D
options.text: Give IV fluids and wait for culture

questions.correct_answer: A. Start IV cefotaxime and IV albumin
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Start IV cefotaxime and IV albumin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ SBP with rising creatinine mandates immediate cefotaxime and albumin to prevent renal failure.

questions.text: With regards to the treatment of thyrotoxicosis of Grave's disease, which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Propylthiouracil is suitable in breastfeeding patients.

options.label: B
options.text: Large goitre is an indication for thyroidectomy.

options.label: C
options.text: Radioiodine is recommended for management in pregnancy.

options.label: D
options.text: Agranulocytosis is a complication associated with carbimazole.

questions.correct_answer: C. Radioiodine is recommended for management in pregnancy.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Radioiodine is recommended for management in pregnancy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Radioiodine therapy is contraindicated during pregnancy due to its risk of fetal thyroid destruction. Propylthiouracil is the preferred antithyroid drug in early pregnancy and is safe during breastfeeding. Agranulocytosis is a rare but serious adverse effect of antithyroid medications.
  • ➤ Radioiodine therapy is contraindicated during pregnancy due to its risk of fetal thyroid destruction.
  • ➤ Radioiodine therapy is contraindicated during pregnancy
  • ➤ Propylthiouracil is the preferred antithyroid drug in early pregnancy and is safe during breastfeeding.
  • ➤ Agranulocytosis is a rare but serious adverse effect of antithyroid medications.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man is brought to the emergency department following a high-speed road traffic collision. He is hemodynamically stable and fully conscious. As part of the trauma evaluation, a chest radiograph is taken and given below. Which of the following procedures is contraindicated in this clinical setting?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Intercostal drainage tube

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of diaphragmatic rupture with intrathoracic herniation of abdominal organs, intercostal drainage tube insertion is contraindicated due to risk of injuring herniated viscera.

questions.explanation:
Ans.

questions.text: Which of the following is the primary mechanism by which fomepizole prevents the toxic effects of ethylene glycol poisoning?

options.label: A
options.text: Fomepizole inhibits the enzyme responsible for converting glycolic acid to oxalic acid, directly preventing renal toxicity

options.label: B
options.text: Fomepizole Non competitively inhibits alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH), preventing the formation of toxic metabolites like glycolic acid and oxalic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Fomepizole has Higher affinity for alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH) as compared to ethylene glycol

questions.correct_answer: C. Fomepizole has Higher affinity for alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH) as compared to ethylene glycol
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Fomepizole has Higher affinity for alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH) as compared to ethylene glycol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fomepizole acts as a competitive inhibitor of alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH), with higher affinity than ethylene glycol or methanol, thereby preventing the formation of toxic metabolites such as glycolic acid and oxalic acid.

questions.text: A 62-year-old woman presents with fever, temporal headache, and jaw claudication. ESR is 110 mm/h. Fundoscopy shows pale swollen optic disc. What is the most important next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) High-dose corticosteroids

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Suspected GCA with visual symptoms mandates immediate high-dose steroids to prevent permanent blindness.

questions.text: A 30-year-old primigravida with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) has just delivered via forceps. Following the delivery of the placenta, she experiences sudden severe bleeding. The uterus is well contracted. On examination, her pulse rate (PR) is 100, blood pressure (BP) is 90/60 mmHg, and the patient appears drowsy. Immediate resuscitation is done, and blood transfusion is started. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: Examine for vaginal and cervical tears

questions.correct_answer: B. Examine for vaginal and cervical tears
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Examine for vaginal and cervical tears

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the case of postpartum hemorrhage with a well-contracted uterus , the most likely cause of bleeding is vaginal or cervical tears . The first step in management is to examine the vagina and cervix for tears before proceeding with other interventions like oxytocics or more invasive treatments.
  • ➤ In the case of postpartum hemorrhage with a well-contracted uterus , the most likely cause of bleeding is vaginal or cervical tears .
  • ➤ postpartum hemorrhage
  • ➤ well-contracted uterus
  • ➤ most likely cause of bleeding
  • ➤ vaginal or cervical tears
  • ➤ The first step in management is to examine the vagina and cervix for tears before proceeding with other interventions like oxytocics or more invasive treatments.
  • ➤ first step
  • ➤ examine the vagina and cervix for tears

questions.text: A 68-year-old woman presents with increased urinary urgency and frequency for the past 4 months, sometimes accompanied by urge incontinence. She has a known history of early-stage Alzheimer’s disease, for which she is on donepezil. The physician is planning pharmacologic management for overactive bladder (OAB) and is reviewing drug choices, especially keeping in mind her risk of cognitive side effects. Which of the following statements regarding the pharmacology of drugs used for overactive bladder is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Solifenacin is a long-acting vesicoselective M3 antagonist

options.label: B
options.text: Oxybutynin is very short acting antimuscarinic drug

options.label: C
options.text: Mirabegron is useful in management of overactive bladder without affecting muscarinic receptors

options.label: D
options.text: Trospium is antimuscarinic drug with high CNS penetration and should be avoided in Alzheimer’s disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Trospium is antimuscarinic drug with high CNS penetration and should be avoided in Alzheimer’s disease
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Trospium is antimuscarinic drug with high CNS penetration and should be avoided in Alzheimer’s disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Trospium has low CNS penetration and is a safer antimuscarinic choice in elderly and Alzheimer's patients. The statement that it has high CNS penetration is incorrect.
  • ➤ Trospium has low CNS penetration and is a safer antimuscarinic choice in elderly and Alzheimer's patients.
  • ➤ Trospium has low CNS penetration and is a safer antimuscarinic choice in elderly and Alzheimer's patients.
  • ➤ The statement that it has high CNS penetration is incorrect.

questions.text: How does cluster sampling differ from multistage sampling in large-scale field surveys?

options.label: A
options.text: Multistage sampling uses only one level of random selection; cluster uses several.

options.label: B
options.text: Cluster sampling uses stratified selection at each level, whereas multistage uses fixed blocks.

options.label: C
options.text: Multistage sampling applies random selection at multiple levels; cluster typically selects only one level as the unit.

options.label: D
options.text: Both are identical in terms of error rates and sampling variability.

questions.correct_answer: C. Multistage sampling applies random selection at multiple levels; cluster typically selects only one level as the unit.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Multistage sampling applies random selection at multiple levels; cluster typically selects only one level as the unit.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Multistage sampling involves random selection at multiple hierarchical levels , offering more flexibility and representativeness, whereas cluster sampling generally selects one level (e.g., villages, schools) and samples within that cluster.
  • ➤ Multistage sampling
  • ➤ multiple hierarchical levels
  • ➤ cluster sampling

questions.text: Categorize the statements below regarding trauma patients as true (T) or false (F): Arterial blood gas is a useful indicator of shock in patients of trauma, and trending these values can reflect improvements with resuscitation. In patients with suspected fracture of the cribriform plate, a Ryles tube is inserted nasally. It is essential to catheterize the patient transurethrally before you can proceed to examine the perineum and genitalia.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) T, F, F

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Arterial blood gases are valuable for assessing shock and response to resuscitation. Gastric tubes should be inserted orally in the context of potential cribriform plate fractures to avoid intracranial passage. Lastly, a careful examination of the perineum and genitalia is necessary before catheterization to avoid exacerbating any potential urethral injuries.
  • ➤ Arterial blood gases are valuable for assessing shock and response to resuscitation. Gastric tubes should be inserted orally in the context of potential cribriform plate fractures to avoid intracranial passage.
  • ➤ Lastly, a careful examination of the perineum and genitalia is necessary before catheterization to avoid exacerbating any potential urethral injuries.

questions.text: A 27-year-old man presents with high-grade fever, malaise, and systemic signs of inflammation two days after returning from a camping trip. Laboratory investigations reveal elevated serum levels of interleukin-1β (IL-1β) and interleukin-18 (IL-18). The inflammatory response is linked to an intracellular bacterial infection triggering a specific form of programmed cell death. Which of the following best describes the mechanism involved?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pyroptosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pyroptosis is a form of programmed cell death characterized by caspase-1 and caspase-11 activation and release of proinflammatory cytokines IL-1β and IL-18, especially in the setting of intracellular bacterial infections.

questions.text: A cost-effectiveness analysis is conducted to assess a new cancer treatment that prolongs life by 1.5 years but only 0.9 of that is in perfect health. Which of the following metrics best quantifies this outcome?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) QALY

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ QALY quantifies both the quantity and quality of life gained from an intervention, making it the key metric for evaluating cost-effectiveness in clinical decision-making.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding cocaine when used as a local anesthetic?

options.label: A
options.text: It is an ester local anesthetic that blocks calcium channels

options.label: B
options.text: It enhances bleeding at the site of application

options.label: C
options.text: It blocks sodium channels and also causes local vasoconstriction

options.label: D
options.text: It is primarily used for spinal anesthesia due to prolonged action

questions.correct_answer: C. It blocks sodium channels and also causes local vasoconstriction
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) It blocks sodium channels and also causes local vasoconstriction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cocaine acts as a local anesthetic and vasoconstrictor , making it useful in procedures like nasal surgeries. It blocks sodium channels and reduces bleeding, but its clinical use is restricted due to its addictive potential .
  • ➤ Cocaine acts as a local anesthetic and vasoconstrictor , making it useful in procedures like nasal surgeries.
  • ➤ local anesthetic
  • ➤ vasoconstrictor
  • ➤ It blocks sodium channels and reduces bleeding, but its clinical use is restricted due to its addictive potential .
  • ➤ addictive potential

questions.text: All of the following are selective serotonin re-uptake inhibitors except?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Amitriptyline

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) that inhibits both serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake, whereas SSRIs such as escitalopram, fluoxetine, and sertraline selectively inhibit serotonin reuptake only.
  • ➤ Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA)
  • ➤ SSRIs
  • ➤ serotonin reuptake

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman presents with proximal muscle weakness and rash. She has difficulty climbing stairs and rising from a chair. Examination reveals the finding below. What is the most useful investigation to confirm the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Muscle biopsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Muscle biopsy is the definitive test for diagnosing dermatomyositis and differentiating from other myopathies.

questions.text: A patient with stable TAO and chronic proptosis presents with decreased color vision and a new relative afferent pupillary defect (RAPD). Imaging reveals apical orbital crowding. Which intervention is most appropriate?

options.label: B
options.text: Botulinum toxin injection for Müller muscle overaction

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Orbital decompression surgery

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In thyroid-associated orbitopathy , compressive optic neuropathy is a vision-threatening complication. The most effective and urgent treatment in the chronic stable phase with apical crowding is orbital decompression surgery .

  • ➤ orbital decompression surgery

questions.text: Which of the following enzyme makes a transient single-stranded break in the supercoiled DNA double helix, which allows the DNA to unwind and relieve torsional strain during replication?

questions.text: Which of the following is unlikely to be adverse effect with long-term treatment of bipolar disorder with lithium carbonate?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Weight loss

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Long-term lithium therapy is associated with hypothyroidism, nephrogenic diabetes insipidus, and leucocytosis. Weight loss is not a recognized side effect; instead, weight gain is more common.

  • ➤ Weight loss is not a recognized side effect; instead, weight gain is more common.

questions.text: A triple-blinded RCT evaluating a new lipid-lowering agent unexpectedly fails to replicate during meta-analysis. What is the primary reason triple blinding is used in original trials?

options.label: A
options.text: Minimizes Hawthorne effect in placebo arms

options.label: C
options.text: Avoids confirmation bias during data analysis

questions.correct_answer: C. Avoids confirmation bias during data analysis
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Avoids confirmation bias during data analysis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Triple blinding minimizes subject bias , investigator bias , and most importantly, confirmation bias by the data analyst , which can otherwise distort interpretation and reporting of trial outcomes.
  • ➤ subject bias
  • ➤ investigator bias
  • ➤ confirmation bias by the data analyst

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with cirrhosis due to chronic hepatitis C presents with confusion, disorientation, and asterixis. His serum ammonia level is elevated. He is diagnosed with hepatic encephalopathy. In addition to lactulose, the physician decides to add a poorly absorbed antibiotic to reduce ammonia-producing gut flora. Which of the following drug combinations is most appropriate for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Neomycin or Rifaximin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neomycin and rifaximin are poorly absorbed antibiotics used in hepatic encephalopathy to reduce ammonia-producing gut flora and lower systemic ammonia levels.
  • ➤ Neomycin and rifaximin

questions.text: A 4-year-old child presents with fever, watery diarrhea, and blood-streaked stool for the past two days. Stool culture is ordered to identify the causative bacterial pathogen. questions.text: A 28-year-old farmer presents with fever, jaundice, and hemoptysis after 7 days of illness. He is hypoxic (SpO2 88% on room air) and hypotensive (BP 90/60 mmHg). Labs show hemoglobin 9.8 g/dL, platelets 60,000/mm³, creatinine 3.2 mg/dL, bilirubin 8.5 mg/dL. Chest CT reveals diffuse alveolar hemorrhage. Despite fluid resuscitation, his condition deteriorates with worsening hemoptysis. What is the most appropriate next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Administer IV ceftriaxone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Severe leptospirosis with pulmonary hemorrhage requires urgent antibiotics (e.g., IV ceftriaxone) and ventilatory support for DAH and hypoxemia. Clinical suspicion arises from occupational exposure and multiorgan involvement; avoid immunosuppression. Rapid intervention is essential to prevent progression to ARDS or death.
  • ➤ Severe leptospirosis with pulmonary hemorrhage requires urgent antibiotics (e.g., IV ceftriaxone) and ventilatory support for DAH and hypoxemia.
  • ➤ Clinical suspicion arises from occupational exposure and multiorgan involvement; avoid immunosuppression.
  • ➤ Rapid intervention is essential to prevent progression to ARDS or death.

questions.text: Which one of the following pressures is primarily regulated by the carotid sinus baroreceptors?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mean arterial pressure

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Carotid sinus baroreceptors primarily regulate mean arterial pressure by modulating autonomic output to maintain hemodynamic stability in response to changes in blood volume or vascular tone.

questions.text: A 27-year-old unmarried woman with a history of regular menstrual cycles presents with a complaint of a missed period. On pelvic examination, no abnormalities are found. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Reassure her that it's normal to have a delayed period

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first step in the management of a missed period is to rule out pregnancy by performing a beta hCG test , as it is the most common cause of amenorrhea in women of reproductive age.

  • ➤ rule out pregnancy
  • ➤ beta hCG test

questions.text: A 30-year-old male software engineer presents to the outpatient department with complaints of reddish discoloration on his upper back and a purple hue around his eyes. He reports difficulty climbing stairs and lifting heavy objects. On examination, there is erythema over the upper back, violaceous rash over the upper eyelids, and cracked rough skin on the lateral digits. Nail fold examination shows periungual erythema with dilated capillary loops. Serum creatinine kinase is significantly elevated. Which of the following statements is false regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Dilated capillary loops in nail fold can be seen in this disease

options.label: B
options.text: Heliotrope rash seen in this disease is associated with anti-Mi-2 antibodies

options.label: C
options.text: Mechanic’s hands can be seen in this disease

options.label: D
options.text: Muscle tenderness is common in this condition

questions.correct_answer: D. Muscle tenderness is common in this condition
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Muscle tenderness is common in this condition

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Dermatomyositis presents with proximal muscle weakness and characteristic skin changes. The disease is associated with elevated muscle enzymes and specific autoantibodies (anti-Mi-2, anti-Jo-1). Muscle tenderness is not a consistent finding.
  • ➤ Dermatomyositis presents with proximal muscle weakness and characteristic skin changes.
  • ➤ The disease is associated with elevated muscle enzymes and specific autoantibodies (anti-Mi-2, anti-Jo-1). Muscle tenderness is not a consistent finding.
